page.title: 07S.& S.& J. SHELLFISH.
page.content: This is a family business run by Mr. Leggett and his daughter Jane who also employ 3 full time and 5 occasional workers. The buildings are old farm buildings rented from Mr. Drummond. The firm has two trawlers, four small boats, a van, expensive processing and freezing equipment, packaging machines and cold storage. A wide range of oil fish and shellfish, some of which bought in from local ports i.e. whelks mussels and frozen prawns, are sold wholesale and through the retail shop. Clams are trawled for in Southampton Water and a new way of processing and marketing them has been devised, the product having been passed safe for consumption by government inspectors, Mr. Leggett hopes to get a licence to export them to America. Sales have increased and new tanks have been installed for fresh lobsters and crabs
